title: M.S., Operations Research

title: B.S., Mathematics

title: Operations Research Analyst
description_1: Contribute to multiple projects using my knowledge of mathematics, statistics, and operations research.
description_2: Lead a small team of interns to develop their skills in programming and operations research.
description_3: Integrate new technologies and with existing solutions and software.

title: Senior Analytics Consultant
description_1: Work on site with clients, collaborating with other contractors on data analysis projects using SAS products.
description_2: Support business development activities for federal and private clients and work with contracts to submit proposals.
description_3: Collaborate with IBM research to update and translate algorithms into useable products for healthcare sponsor.

title: Senior Analytics Consultant
description_1: Work closely with remote clients to understand their needs and translate into tasking for team members.
description_2: Lead small teams to perform various statistical and data analysis studies using a combination of SAS, Netezza, Tableau, R, and Python.
description_3: Provide division wide support as an integer optimization expert and ssisted in business development activities, including writing proposals and initial scoping of projects with clients.

title: Principal Data Scientist
description_1: Serves in many roles from individual contributor to technical lead and integrator to supervisor.
description_2: Exhibits expertise in a multitude of areas including technical solutions, communication skills, creativity, and vision to deliver a diverse set of technical solutions across different FFRDCs.
description_3: Scopes statements of work directly with sponsors, advises on technical approaches for research projects, and supports department staff in developing their technical skills.

title: [Predictive Analytics In Child Welfare: An Assessment Of Current Efforts, Challenges And Opportunities](https://aspe.hhs.gov/pdf-report/predictive-analytics-child-welfare-assessment-current-efforts-challenges-and-opportunities)
description_1: This document explores the state of the use of predictive analytics in child welfare by conducting an environmental scan of child welfare agencies, academia, nonprofit organizations, and for-profit vendors.
description_2: Completed through the support of [HHS ASPE](https://aspe.hhs.gov/).

title: [Predictive Analytics in Child Welfare: Considerations in Contracting Vendors for Predictive Analytics](https://www.mitre.org/publications/technical-papers/predictive-analytics-in-child-welfare-considerations-in-contracting)
description_1: This document gives an overview of sections in an RFP that need to be considered carefully when trying to contract a vendor for predictive analytics support.
description_2: Completed through the support of [HHS ASPE](https://aspe.hhs.gov/).

title: [Predictive Analytics in Child Welfare: An Introduction for Administrators and Policy Makers](https://aspe.hhs.gov/pdf-report/predictive-analytics-child-welfare-introduction-administrators-and-policy-makers)
description_1: This document provides an overview of different analytical approaches and goes into a set of criteria that should be used in determining if predictive analytics is the right approach to solving a problem.
description_2: Completed through the support of [HHS ASPE](https://aspe.hhs.gov/).
